main event: A witness observed a bright object in the sky for approximately one second in Agawam, Massachusetts on October 14, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as being large, possibly the size of a full moon with bright pulsation., The sighting occurred at approximately 40 degrees elevation and was heading southwest., The object remained visible for several minutes despite its brief observation time., It disappeared behind trees after the sighting., The report was made to the local police, indicating concern or interest in the sighted object.
witness description: a civilian who observed the object and reported its characteristics
